CatDescriptText: Miss Gloria Jean Harris, 1195 Juniata Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "In a way, I guess that we do display prejudices against each other. It's shown in the way some talk.  And this is further shown in the way the kids talk on the street when they call each other bad racial names which they probably heard in their homes as well as other sources."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gloria Jean Harris standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
